sentence.Network_en: The present wave of political killings is the work of people trying to derail peace talks.
sentence.Network_cn: 当前的这一系列政治谋杀乃是那些想阻挠和平谈判的人所为。

sentence.Network_en: Are you looking to derail this thing before it even gets going?
sentence.Network_cn: 你是想让事情还没开始就搞砸 吗 ?

sentence.Network_en: Opportunistic trades do not have to derail long - time strategies.
sentence.Network_cn: 机会主义式的交易到是没必要脱离 长期 战略.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from French dérailler, from dé- (expressing removal) + rail 'rail'

entry.def: To derail something such as a plan or a series of negotiations means to prevent it from continuing as planned.

example.ex: The present wave of political killings is the work of people trying to derail peace talks.
example.tran: 当前的这一系列政治谋杀乃是那些想阻挠和平谈判的人所为。

entry.def: If a train is derailed or if it derails, it comes off the track on which it is running.

example.ex: Several people were injured today when a train was derailed...
example.tran: 今天有数人在一列火车出轨时受了伤。

example.ex: No-one knows why the train derailed.
example.tran: 没人知道火车为什么会脱轨。

means.word_mean: 1. cause to run off the tracks;

sentences.sentence: "they had planned to derail the trains that carried atomic waste"

means.word_mean: 2. run off or leave the rails;

sentences.sentence: "the train derailed because a cow was standing on the tracks"

auth_sentence.content: But spikes in food prices can derail those plans.

auth_sentence.content: Oil prices have the potential to derail the global recovery.

sentences.en: The train derailed after it hit a tree.
